intro: Cryptocoryne koenigii, commonly known as the peppergrass or Indian bean蔻, is a species of aquatic plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its dark green, sword-shaped leaves that are often adorned with a waxy coating. This plant thrives in slow-moving freshwater environments and is often found in the roots of submerged trees or in swampy areas. Cryptocoryne koenigii is popular in aquariums due to its hardy nature and aesthetic appeal. It plays a role in providing habitat and oxygenation in both natural and artificial aquatic ecosystems.
